intro: Tephrosia feddemana, commonly known as the African tephrosia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, also known as the legume or bean family, and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant produces pods that contain seeds, and it is often found in dry, open habitats. Tephrosia feddemana is also noted for its potential medicinal uses in traditional African medicine.
